intro: Croton levatii, commonly known as the Sierra Madre croton, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, colorful leaves that vary in hue from green to red and orange. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
